result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  This case dismissed and read in for sentencnig purposes on 15CM5.
DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Set for plea.  8/24/15 at 1:30 pm

Pre-trial conference at 07-01-2015 10:00 am.
Status conference at 07-20-2015 03:00 pm.

15CM124 - Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss, who appeared specially.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Poss states the defendant still needs to apply for representation.  Waived reading of the complaint and stood mute.  Court entered NGP and set for pretrial on 7-1-15 and status on 7-20-15 at 3:00.  15CM05 status rescheduled to 7-20-15.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, without counsel.  Court advised the defendant of the charge and possible penalties.  Defendant would like an attorney.  Court told him to apply with SPD.  AIA set for  6/8/15 at 9:30 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.  As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Michael called referring to his bond that shows to appear 5/25/15 @ 9; explained that there is a criminal case filed and he needs to appear 5/26/15 @ 9:00 a.m.; obviously we are closed Monday the 25th. He stated he will be here 26th @ 9
